event: Earliest human presence in present-day Cuba
Taíno and other Indigenous societies develop agriculture and villages
Havana is founded as a colonial settlement
Sugar plantations expand using enslaved African labor
British briefly occupy Havana during European wars
Cuba becomes the world’s leading sugar producer
Ten Years’ War launches the independence struggle
Final war of independence against Spain begins
Spanish rule ends after U.S. intervention
Cuban Revolution overthrows the Batista regime
Cuba declares itself a socialist state
